Tarzan Pre-2.0 Trunk Build

What is Tarzan?

Tarzan is well-documented, straight-forward, object-oriented PHP5 API for working with some of Amazon's Web Services.

Developer Description

Tarzan is an object-oriented PHP5 API for working with some of Amazon's web services. Tarzan has a consistent API across classes, is fully object-oriented with little-to-no code duplication across the API, has complete API documentation, and is developed by a commercial entity that uses AWS in pretty hardcore ways. This means that that there will be long-term continued support as well as enhancements and helpers that make the API as useful as possible. The API is fully documented, and support is provided primarily by users, for users.

Available Developer Resources

Tarzan was developed for the WarpShare project, then made available as an open source project. I'm always open to patches, feature requests, and the like, but know that I'm currently the only person working on this project. Because of that, the majority of my development efforts will only go to bugfixes and enhancements that will be valuable to me in building WarpShare?. If you want to see a new feature integrated, or a particular bug fixed, make it as easy for me as possible. Generating a patch and sending it to me is always the preferred method as it's the easiest for me.

Eventually, as I'm able to get more people working with me on this, Tarzan's scope will widen to include more community-oriented code and improvements. If you want this thing to rock, then be willing to contribute time, energy and code of your own.

Welcome to the project! :)

Project Links

  • Tarzan Project Page — This is the main project page.
  • Issue Tracker — File bugs and feature requests. Keep track of progress.
  • Subversion Source Browser — View the code from the latest commits.

Subversion Tools

  • Windows — Tortoise SVN
  • Mac OS X — Versions or Cornerstone
  • Linux — SmartSVN (also runs on Windows and Mac OS X)

Documentation Links

  • Documentation Wiki — General project-related information, plans, basic examples, etc.
  • API Reference — Documentation for every class, method, and property. The latest version of this same documentation.
  • API Reference (CHM) — Same as above, except as a downloadable .chm file. Native support in Windows, Mac OS X users have Chmox, and Linux CHM viewers has info for Linux users.
  • API Reference (Examples) — The API Reference has example code for nearly every method. These are the code samples by themselves as color-coded PHP Source (.phps) files.
